speaker: MULDER
line: Can you help me? I'm looking for a woman... Excuse me, I'm looking for a Dana Scully who was brought into... Excuse me, I'm looking for a patient, Dana Scully... Is there an admitting nurse here? Look! Can someone help me here?

speaker: INTERN
line: Look, Sir. You're going to have to calm down.

speaker: MULDER
line: I will calm down when someone gives me a reason to calm down. Now I'm looking for a patient who was admitted to the ER!

speaker: INTERN
line: Dana Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes.

speaker: INTERN
line: I heard you the first time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, where is she?

speaker: INTERN
line: I have her in the ICU.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is that?

speaker: INTERN
line: You have to tell me who you are first.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is she?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder... Where you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: ICU.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're looking pretty good for a dead man.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm only half dead.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You have a lot to answer for, Agent Mulder! You guys hold here.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened to her?

speaker: SKINNER
line: She went into hypo vilemic shock.

speaker: MULDER
line: Due to what? Do to what?!

speaker: SKINNER
line: She's dying! Let's go.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let go of me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: There's nothing you can do.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get the hell off of me!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Don't do this! Don't!

speaker: BLEVINS
line: I'm still at a loss here in going forward. This situation developing unexpectantly during a formal inquiry into your reported death, Agent Mulder. The fact of your being here today, very much alive it gives the effect of reshaping this investigation into something all together different. As we're not put upon to verify the identity of this body found in your apartment and the circumstances which led to this.

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: Would you care to enlighten us on these circumstances?

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you suggesting that I can?

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Agent Mulder, we are here informally to give you the chance to help yourself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Help myself, how?

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: By allowing any fact or details which might serve to let us go forward with this inquiry in a more informed manner.

speaker: MULDER
line: That helps you, how doesn't that help me?

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Agent Mulder, this is going to quickly become a murder investigation. Criminal charges are going to be made.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We have only one other suspect. But she may no longer be able to testify on her own behalf.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Agent Scully lied to us. Why?

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: Who's protecting whom, Agent Mulder?

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Your choice is your own, but your failure to answer these questions will reflect poorly on the record of the formal inquiry.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are we finished then?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Word of advice from a friend, keep playing it the way you are.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks, buddy.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Hey, right now, you need a buddy, you need all the help you can get.

speaker: MULDER
line: You should have mentioned that at the hospital when you were hauling my ass off!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Hey, I saved your ass, Agent Mulder! I've been withholding forensic evidence about the body found on your apartment floor. Until you showed up last night, I was the one keeping your secret, I had no choice but to bring you in. Scully'll verify all that.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's a good place to lay it, considering her condition.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You want me to lay it where it belongs, Agent Mulder? Pathology turned up two gunshot wounds to the dead man in your apartment. One fired point-blank through the left temple with a handgun, the second a post-mortem wound to the face to remove the man's identity. Now, I'd be happy to verify the ballistics on that first shot.

speaker: MULDER
line: How can you help me?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Tell me why Scully lied for you.

speaker: MULDER
line: The disease she has was given to her by somebody connected to the FBI, to a mole working here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Who?

speaker: MULDER
line: I failed to find that out, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You don't want to forget who your friends are, Agent Mulder. To remember who you can trust.

speaker: MAN ON TV
line: I don't think there are any appropriate limits to human knowledge. As long as science is done openly, and with free will, then I don't think there are any limits.

speaker: CHAIRMAN
line: Senator Kennedy...

speaker: KENNEDY
line: Doctor... you've ah... stated that the ah... cloning humans would be ah... ill considered and technically ah... difficult to accomplish. Can you expand a little bit on what you see as the biggest ah... technical obstacle to human cloning.

speaker: CSM
line: I trust you've heard.

speaker: ELDER
line: Mulder is alive.

speaker: CSM
line: As I said, he's not to be underestimated.

speaker: ELDER
line: Yes, as you said. Though I hear he has you to thank in some part for his new freedom.

speaker: CSM
line: Using a stolen ID, Mulder was able to get inside the Advanced Research Project Facility.

speaker: ELDER
line: And you allowed him to escape.

speaker: CSM
line: Yes.

speaker: ELDER
line: We're too vulnerable. Our man in the FBI is exposed, what Mulder may have seen could expose our plans.

speaker: CSM
line: What Mulder's seen only serves us. Serves to ensure our plans. Mulder's in trouble, he needs help, and we can give it to him.

speaker: ELDER
line: In exchange for?

speaker: CSM
line: His new loyalty. To us. As I've said all along, Mulder's much more valuable to us alive.

speaker: ELDER
line: You can proceed now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what are you doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I heard you were being moved out of the ICU, that you were feeling better.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, somebody's going to see you here.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's okay. I'm officially among the undead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: I did not come here to talk about that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, don't try and protect me. I need to know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, there's not much to talk about anyway, I'm going to testify to everything I know in front of the FBI assembly. The conspiracy, the men behind it, what I believe is its purpose.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you find out who in the FBI is involved?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. But that doesn't matter now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes it does.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully, how about those Yankees, huh?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, Skinner has evidence against you. He knows that you killed that man they found in your apartment.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, Skinner's withholding it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, Skinner's dirty. He's not your friend. I'm almost certain that he's the man inside on this.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't believe that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If you testify, he will use it to ruin you.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, not Skinner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's been in a position to know everything from the beginning, everything that we've done over the past four years.

speaker: MULDER
line: But if I don't testify now they'll start to bury the truth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well then, you have to lay it on me. You have to tell them that I was the one who killed that man.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can.... I can't do that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, you can. Mulder, if I can save you, let me. Let me at least give some meaning to what's happened to me.

speaker: MRS SCULLY
line: Dana?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi, Mom.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi, Mrs. Scully.

speaker: MRS. SCULLY
line: I hope I'm not interrupting...

speaker: MULDER
line: No. I was just on my way out. Hi, I'm Fox Mulder, I don't think we've ever met.

speaker: BILL
line: Bill Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry about your sister.

speaker: BILL
line: Mr. Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: BILL
line: I know something about you, about what Dana's been through with you, so let's leave the work away from here, okay? Let her die with dignity.

speaker: MULDER
line: Please tell me you're here with severe chest pains.

speaker: CSM
line: You should be glad for why I'm here, pay you some respect.

speaker: MULDER
line: Go to hell.

speaker: CSM
line: For your cleverness, and your resource, what you managed to do for Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: CSM
line: Well, breaching the security at the Defense Department Facility. Finding the cure for her disease.

speaker: MULDER
line: What I found was useless.

speaker: CSM
line: On the contrary, it's essential to her survival. If you like, we could step outside and I might explain myself? I'm here tonight as a friend, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: He promised me it would be in here.

speaker: BYERS
line: I'll be damned. It never occurred to me what the deionized water might be for.

speaker: LANGLEY
line: It was a microchip we were looking for.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: This is a cure for cancer?

speaker: MULDER
line: It may be for Scully's.

speaker: BYERS
line: How?

speaker: MULDER
line: Shortly after she was abducted she discovered a small metallic chip implanted subcutaneously in your neck... It was a short time after she had it removed that she developed cancer.

speaker: BYERS
line: It's unreal.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Too freakin' amazing!

speaker: MULDER
line: Watch your language, Frohike, and grab me some tweezers.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Mr. Kritschgau, thank you for being here today and for cooperating with this investigation. We hope you can provide information that will allow us to make formal charges for the murder of Defense employee, Scott Ostlehoff. Mr. Kritschgau, we have learned that you were in contact with Agents Mulder and Scully just prior to this man's death.

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: That's correct.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: And that you may have given them classified information... What motivated this?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: My knowledge of government involvement in a conspiracy against the American people.

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: Now before... before we go into any specifics on the subject, I'd like to ask you a more pointed question. Do you know who killed Scott Ostlehoff?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: No I don't.

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: Do you know of any connection between his death and Agents Mulder or Scully?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: No. I'm aware of one death in connection though... My son who died early this morning.

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: Mr. Kritschgau, you're employed by the Department of Defense. Is that correct?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: Technically. Part of my remuneration has come from another source. A Congressional lobbying firm. Something called 'Roush'.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Roush? You have any idea what that is?

speaker: KRITSCHGAU
line: No, sir.

speaker: BILL
line: Crazy. This is crazy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Crazy in what sense? In that it might save your sister's life?

speaker: BILL
line: You're not a doctor. You have no place in even suggesting this .. this science fiction...this

speaker: MULDER
line: This is not science fiction.

speaker: BILL
line: You've never heard of it!

speaker: MRS SCULLY
line: Bill... I think there's an obvious... difference of opinion.

speaker: BILL
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think... that everybody here has their heart in the right place. But I need it to be my decision.

speaker: BILL
line: Dana...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know you're only looking out for me, Bill. But I don't think you have all the facts.

speaker: MRS SCULLY
line: Don't you think you should listen to your doctor?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. I am.

speaker: MULDER
line: Would she have to stop her conventional treatment?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: To be honest, at this point... the only approach I have left... with her particular cancer is quite unconventional.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'd like to try this.

speaker: BILL
line: MULDER: Yes, I do.

speaker: BILL
line: You see, she's your big defender, but I think the truth is, she just doesn't want to disappoint you.

speaker: MULDER
line: If it works, I don't care what you think she thinks.

speaker: BILL
line: You're a real piece of work, you know that, Mr. Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why is that, because I don't think the way you think? Because I won't just sit passively back and watch the family tragedy unfold?

speaker: BILL
line: You're the reason for it. And I've already lost one sister to this quest you're on, now I'm losing another. Has it been worth it? To you, I mean, have you found what you've been looking for?

speaker: MULDER
line: No...

speaker: BILL
line: No. You know how that makes me feel?

speaker: MULDER
line: In a way, I think I do. I lost someone very close to me. I lost a sister, I lost my father, all because of this thing I'm looking for.

speaker: BILL
line: MULDER: Yeah. Little green aliens.

speaker: BILL
line: You're one sorry son of a bitch. Not a whole lot more to say.

speaker: MULDER
line: One sorry son of a bitch speaking.

speaker: CSM
line: How's our patient? You did find the chip, didn't you Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes.

speaker: CSM
line: I can imagine there must have been a question as to it's medical value.

speaker: MULDER
line: There still is.

speaker: CSM
line: And so I have yet to earn your trust... in spite of my gesture.

speaker: MULDER
line: You could say that, yeah.

speaker: CSM
line: Well I have something else to offer you. I've arranged a meeting I think you'll want to attend, Mr. Mulder.

speaker: WAITRESS
line: Tabasco sauce. Cures anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll keep that in mind.

speaker: WAITRESS
line: You know him or something?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think that's my sister. Samantha?

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: I was afraid I'd never see you again. He always told me something had happened to you that night.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who? Who told you that?

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: My father.

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: I never really knew what happened. I could never put the memories all back together. But, as much as I tried to remember, I tried more to forget.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: I was 8 years old, and frightened to death. And they told me that I was an orphan.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you called that man your father?

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: Some time later, I don't know how long, my foster parents took me to a hotel room and said that I was gonna see my father.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you knew who your father was?

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: I thought I knew. But, he told me that it had all been a secret, and that he and Mom hadn't told anyone to protect the family.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you believed that.

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: He was so kind to me, and he was the only one I could remember from before what happened.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't remember anything about that night?

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: I remember... you... I remember something... men and... and then nothing.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can help you. You were abducted, Samantha, I can help you to remember.

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: I don't want to, Fox. I don't.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then why come here at all?

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: My father told me that he'd found you, you wanted to see me very badly, that you'd been looking for me for a long time. Is that true? I'm so sorry, Fox. And I wish that I'd known how to find you.

speaker: MULDER
line: What you've been told... I want you to listen to me, okay? What you've been told by that man may not be true.

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: Why do you say that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because the man that brought you here has known where I've been for a very long time.

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: I don't understand. Why wouldn't he tell me?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, but I think he's kept a lot of things from you.

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: I don't believe you. He's been a good father to me. He's given me a life and he cared for me when there was no one else.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then I want you to come with me, come with me to see Mom.

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: Mom is alive?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes. And I know she'd like to see you very much.

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: I can't.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why not?

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: It's too much. I didn't want to come here at all, Fox. I was afraid to see you. I have another life now, I have children of my own.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, please, don't go.

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: I can't stay here right now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Alright, just tell me how I can find you.

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: I need some time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just... just tell me where to find you.

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: Please don't, Fox!

speaker: MULDER
line: We will do this on your time, just...

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: Please? Please let me go. I promise you, I'll think about it.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Doing okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Um... either it's my head or I'm a long way from med school but I can't remember what you're injecting me with.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Flouro-dioxy-glucose. If you're making any progress, it might show up first in the PET scan.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're not holding your breath are you?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I'm going after your cancer as aggressively as I know how, Dana. If I could just start your immune system... If I could get your cidalitic cells to recognize your tumor as something to attack... Then there's a chance.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have you ever witnessed a miracle, Dr. Zuckerman?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I don't know that I have. But I have seen people make recoveries. Come back from so far back, I can't explain it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Isn't that a miracle?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Maybe there are miracles... But I don't dare call them that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: CSM
line: My apologies for the rather hasty departure last night.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you want from me?

speaker: CSM
line: Want from you?

speaker: MULDER
line: You give me these things, the only things I ever wanted and I can't think of any reason for you to do so.

speaker: CSM
line: Well that's true, no act is completely selfless. But I've come today not to... not to ask, but to offer. To offer you the truth that you've so desperately sought. About the project, about the men who've conspired to protect it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know the truth.

speaker: CSM
line: Do you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I spoke to one of your men.

speaker: CSM
line: And you know that he's not a liar.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've seen enough to know he's not a liar, yeah.

speaker: CSM
line: He's seen but scant pieces of the whole.

speaker: MULDER
line: What more can you show me?

speaker: CSM
line: This man you spoke to, Michael Kritschgau, he has deceived you with beautiful lies. He's told you that everything you've ever believed about the existence of extraterrestrial life is untrue.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you saying?

speaker: CSM
line: As I said, I'm offering you a chance to know the truth.

speaker: MULDER
line: In exchange for what?

speaker: CSM
line: Quit the FBI, come work for me. I can make your problems go away.

speaker: MULDER
line: No deal.

speaker: CSM
line: After all I've given you?

speaker: MULDER
line: What have... what have you given me? A claim of a cure for Scully, is she cured? You show me my sister only to take her right back. You've given me nothing!

speaker: CSM
line: I intend to keep my promises, I just need something from you.

speaker: MULDER
line: You murdered my father, you killed Scully's sister, and if Scully dies, I will kill you. I don't care whose father you are, I will put you down.

speaker: CSM
line: Well, you're certainly capable, so I've been told. I understand you have a hearing tomorrow where you'll have to testify to these murderous impulses of yours. When you reconsider, the offer still stands!

speaker: MRS SCULLY
line: Dana? Dr. Zuckerman called. He ah... he said that you wanted to see me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm so sorry... I fight and I fight and I fight... But I'm so stupid.

speaker: MRS SCULLY
line: What? What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've come so far in my life on simple faith, and now when I need it the most I just push it away. I mean, why... why do I wear this? Why do I wear this, Mom? I put something that I don't even know or understand under the skin of my neck. I will subject myself to these crazy treatments, and I keep telling myself that I'm doing everything I can, but it's a lie!

speaker: MRS SCULLY
line: You have not lost your faith, Dana.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But I have. In a way. And when you asked Father McCue to dinner to administer to my faith... I just closed off to him.

speaker: MRS SCULLY
line: What's important now is that you save your energy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not getting better, Mom.

speaker: MRS SCULLY
line: You don't know that...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. The PET scan shows no improvement.

speaker: MRS SCULLY
line: I know you're afraid... I know your afraid to tell me, but you have to tell someone.

speaker: MAN ON TV
line: I'll make a statement right here. Cloning will continue. The human mind will continue to inquire into this. Human cloning will take place in my lifetime. I think it's right and proper.

speaker: ELDER
line: Turn on your television. Are you watching the hearings? Do you see who's there? He's gathering information. For who? Our colleague was supposed to have fixed the FBI problem. You will fix it now. Do you understand me? Then I will fix it for good.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Agent Mulder, will you please take a seat. Something urgently important has come to the fore. As you're set to testify on your own behalf later today, I've received alarming forensic evidence from the man's body found in your apartment. I have here in my hand ballistic data matching your service weapon, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where did you get that?

speaker: BLEVINS
line: I'm not at liberty to say. But unless you can offer up someone else who might have fired the kill shot, everything points to you as this man's murderer. Are you prepared to give testimony about the man who fired the shot?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why am I here?

speaker: BLEVINS
line: The man worked for the Department of Defense, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: The man was spying on me.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Do you know for whom? Agent Scully was prepared to name the man at the FBI who was involved in this plot against you and her. We believe she was about to name Assistant Director Skinner, whom we have learned has been working inside the FBI with a secret agenda.

speaker: MULDER
line: I refuse to believe that.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: We've accumulated some substantial evidence against him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you show it to me?

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Agent Mulder, if you name this man today in your testimony... we can file charges against him. Charges which may very well exonerate you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Name Skinner and save myself?

speaker: BLEVINS
line: That's what I called you here to recommend. As a friend.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll see you at the hearing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Good morning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing here? You have a hearing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. I came by last night, but I... I didn't have the heart to wake you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Came by for what? Mulder, what is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I was lost last night. But as I stood here, I thought I'd found my way. I've been... ah .. I've been offered a deal, a deal that could save my life in a way. And though I'd refused the deal earlier, I left here last night with my mind made up to take it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A deal with who?

speaker: MULDER
line: It doesn't matter, I'm not taking the deal, I'm not taking any deal. Not after what happened this morning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened this morning?

speaker: MULDER
line: Section Chief Blevins directed me to implicate Skinner. To name him as the man inside in the FBI. Who may have deceived us both. And if I name him, they'll protect me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you going to name him?

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then they'll prosecute you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, they have evidence against me, they know I killed that man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, even with the ballistics evidence, I can still be the shoot...

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, I can't let you take the blame. Because of your brother, because of your mother, and because I couldn't live with it. To live the lie, you have to believe it. Like these men who deceive us, who gave you this disease. We all have our faith, and mine is in the truth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then why'd you come here if you'd already made up your mind?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because I knew you'd talk me out of it if I was making a mistake.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You'll be in my prayers.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have the Father say a few Hail Mulders for me, okay?

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: He's a no show. I'm going to ask for a bench warrant.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sorry I'm late.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Agent Mulder... the assembled members of this review panel first convened to address your reported death. Only to find shortly that this report had been a lie. That you were indeed very much alive... and that the body found in your apartment, believed to be yours was a murder victim. Killed with a weapon issued by the FBI and registered to you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Respectfully, Sir. I've come here today to set the record straight so that this process you've begun came be completed and the guilty parties can be named.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Respectfully, Sir. I'd like to ask for a short break.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm... ready to proceed please sir.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Go on, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Four years ago, while working on an assignment outside the FBI mainstream, I was paired with Special Agent Dana Scully, who I believed was sent to spy on me. To debunk my investigations into the paranormal. That Agent Scully did not follow these orders is a testament to her integrity as an investigator, a scientist, and a human being. She has paid dearly for this integrity.

speaker: BLEVINS
line: Agent Mulder, Agent Scully lied straight face to this panel about your death.

speaker: MULDER
line: She did lied because I asked her to. Because I had evidence of a conspiracy. A conspiracy against the American people.

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: We've already heard testimony to these allegations, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: AND a conspiracy intended to destroy the lives of those who would reveal it's true purpose. To conduct experiments on unwitting victims to further their secret agenda for someone further into the government operating at levels without restraint or responsibility. Without morals or conscience... Men who pretend to honor as they deceive.. The price of this betrayal, the lives and reputations of those deceived. Agent Scully... is now in a hospital bed right now diagnosed with terminal cancer. The victim of these same tests. Conducted without her knowledge or consent. By these same men who are trying to cover their tracks who suborn and persecute the same people they've used in their plot I will now call by name!

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: Agent Mulder, did you or did you not shoot the man found dead in your apartment?

speaker: MULDER
line: I will answer Sir.

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: Did you shoot Scott Ostlehoff? Employee of the Department of Defense?

speaker: MULDER
line: I will answer that question, Sir.

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: Answer the question asked, Agent Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: I will answer the question after I name the man!

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: AGENT MULDER!

speaker: MULDER
line: I will answer that question after I name the man who's responsible for Agent Scully! The same man who directed that my apartment be surveilled by the DoD. A man I want to see prosecuted for his crimes! Who's sitting in this very room as I speak!

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: Agent Mulder, the Section Chief asked you a question you are going to answer!

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't do that.

speaker: SENIOR AGENT
line: You can and you will!

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't do that sir, because the Section Chief is the man I'm about to name!

speaker: SKINNER
line: The Smoking Man's dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: How?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Shot through his window. Forensics found it at the scene. We're assuming it's his blood.

speaker: MULDER
line: Assuming?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well... no body was found but there was too much blood loss for anyone to have survived. This afternoon when you named Blevins... how did you know?

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't. I just guessed.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, it was a hell of a guess. Blevins had been on payroll for four years to a biotechnology company called Roush, which is somehow connected to all this.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sure whatever connections there were, they're being erased right now.

speaker: SKINNER
line: They're cleaning up, taking everything away.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not everything. Scully's cancer's gone into remission.

speaker: SKINNER
line: That's unbelievable news.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's the best news I could have ever heard.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What turned it around?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. I don't think we'll ever know.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Can I see her?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, she's in there with her family right now, but I'm sure she'd love to see you.
